comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: Not the famous SS Lusitania sunk by a U-Boat, but I assume the one mentioned at www.theshipslist.com/ships/lines/orient.html "Lusitania built 1871 1877 transferred from Pacific Steam Nav.Co, 1900 sold to Elder Dempster's Beaver Line. 3,877 tons"

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From the identifying landmarks, it looks like the 'Lusitania' is moored in Neutral Bay and the photographer (Henry King) is near Kirribilli House on the rocks. There is a Sydney Morning Herald article of 21.8.1888, with the R.M.S. Lusitania moored at Neutral Bay and a wonderful full description of the journey from London. Maybe it is the date of this photo? - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13693996
